title: Ping spikes
body: I don't remember when it started, but recently I've been getting ping spikes of up to 500 ms every 10-30 seconds in games, and each spike seems to last from 5-10 seconds. This affects my gameplay quite a lot as you can probably assume, but I can't seem to find the cause of it. I have 2 brothers who play on the same connection as me and they don't have any lag, so it's likely my laptop, but nothing I do seems to work. So far I've tried freeing up disk space by uninstalling things and removing saved files, as well as giving League higher CPU priority and disabling packet coalescing. Any other ideas you guys might have that I could try?

replies.body: It sounds like you might be experiencing packet loss.  This could be caused by a more local connection issue, or even bandwidth use.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) so we can really find out for sure, and let me know what you find!

It says 
"Your average ping was 152 milliseconds. The worst ping you experienced was 691ms. This means you experienced high ping during this game, which is likely where you were seeing issues. See below for a few recommendations to help out with this." 
and 
"Your average percentage of packet loss for this game was 2.98%. Overall, this means you had a high amount of packets lost during the game. This can be caused by various network issues, so please see below for a few common steps that can help reduce packet loss."

So far I've tried giving giving the files exceptions to the firewall and updating the drivers, but I was unable to use the Netalyzr tool as Google Chrome, Internet Explorer, and Mozilla Firefox all don't seem to support the Java add-on as they used to. I'll try restarting the router or using the Hextech Repair tool and see if those help.
